newsitem.title: UK: Manders shares lower after profit fall.
newsitem.headline: Manders shares lower after profit fall.

text.p: Shares in printing inks and coatings specialist Manders Plc fell sharply in early dealing on Wednesday after it reported a 53 percent drop in interim pretax profit.
Shares in the group were down 33-1/2 pence at 200 pence by 0855 GMT after it said depressed market conditions and intensified competition hit profit margins across the company.

A market-maker in Manders, which was marked down 36 pence at the opening, said volumes were thin. He said the fall reflected "sentiment after the figures", which showed pretax profit of 2.6 million stg compared with 5.5 million a year before.

Kleinwort Benson analyst Jeremy Chantry said Manders had been the victim of a price war in specialist inks "with too many people chasing the business", exacerbated by an inability to pass on rises in raw material costs.
But Chantry said, "We could be over the worst." He is predicting a 30 percent pick-up in pretax profit in 1997 from 1996 levels, despite very competitive market conditions.
"They don't lack anything in technology generally," he said.
Manders pointed to a "marginal improvement" in second-half sales, although it said results for the period will be affected by an estimated one million stg restructuring charge.
